title: Telegraph Travel Awards 2015/16: win eight luxurious long weekends in France
text: Owned and run by the Sibuet family for more than 30 years, Maisons & Hotels Sibuet ( experience-sibuet.com ) are among some of the finest hotels in some of the most beautiful areas of France. The collection is one of Europe’s most innovative groups and includes hotels in the French Alps, Lyon and the south of France. The properties are characterised by their unique design, attention to detail and sensational gourmet offerings, as well as Pure Altitude – the group’s award-winning spa brand. Sibuet are offering a total of eight three-night weekend breaks across a number of their French properties, staying on a half-board basis. The overall prize totals more than £30,000 in value. How to enter Follow this link to tell us about your favourite travel companies and destinations - and to enter the draw for one of 27 prizes . You will need to leave your name, telephone number and a valid email address. See here for full terms and conditions . The prize Explore some of the most stunning areas of France through Maisons & Hotels Sibuet. This incredible prize will offer a series of eight weekend breaks, each at a different Sibuet hotel. The prize includes breakfast and dinner at each of the hotel's superb restaurants. Jocelyne Sibuet is renowned for creating hotels full of character that bring each hotel’s unique design and location to life. Discover the charms of Provence at Domaine de la Baume, a renovated 18th-century guesthouse formerly owned by the artist Bernard Buffet or take part in a wine tasting at La Bastide de Marie in Luberon that's located in its own vineyard, where Sibuet produce their own award-winning wine. Jocelyne Sibuet is renowned for creating hotels full of character Next, travel south and enjoy a glamorous weekend on the Cote d’Azur staying at the Mediterranean influenced Villa Marie in St Tropez with its magnificent views over the fashionable Bay of Pampelonne. Follow this with a food lovers dream city break at the five star hideaway, Cour des Lodges, sampling some of Lyon's many restaurants in France’s gastronomic capital. Maisons & Hotels Sibuet are world renowned for their luxurious mountain hotels. Over the ski season, escape for a romantic snowy break to stay at Hotel Mont Blanc and Le Lodge Park, two of the best hotels in the stylish resort of Megeve. This picturesque resort attracts a dazzling array of celebrities who flock to the resort for its superb skiing and après ski scene. Hotel des Dromonts is a new property that opened last year as the only hotel in Avoriaz , one of the highest resorts in the Alps. With retro-inspired interiors referencing the 60s this cosy hotel offers ski in/ski out access to the Portes du Soleil ski area, one of the largest in the Alps. The prize also includes a weekend at Sibuet’s newest property, Terminal Neige: Le Totem, which will be opening in the popular French ski resort of Flaine in December 2015. This exciting addition to the Sibuet portfolio will be the first in a series of contemporary design-led 3* hotels opening up across the Alps. Telegraphtravel
